intro: Coccoloba rubescens, commonly known as the red-leaved poinsettia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its striking red bracts that surround small, inconspicuous flowers. It thrives in warm, humid climates and prefers well-drained soil. Coccoloba rubescens is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant foliage and seasonal color changes.
